## Description
Implement unit tests for PayPalProcessor using trait-based mocking with dependency injection

## Reason for Delegation
Task requires unit tests for PayPalProcessor across multiple files (PayPalProcessor, StripeProcessor, PaymentAdapterFactory) with complex interactions involving dependency injection, factory pattern, and test isolation. Touches 4+ files in backend/src/payment directory and associated test files, exceeding 400 LOC and involving multiple domains.

```
/// Trait for payment processors - allows for dynamic dispatch and mocking
#[async_trait]
pub trait PaymentAdapter: Send + Sync + Clone + 'static {

---
bash: OK
    #[test]
    fn test_factory_new() {
        let factory = PaymentAdapterFactory::new(
            "sk_test_stripe".to_string(),
            "whsec_stripe".to_string(),
            "client_id_paypal".to_string(),
            "secret_paypal".to_string(),
            "sandbox".to_string(),
        );

        assert_eq!(factory.stripe_secret_key, "sk_test_stripe");
        assert_eq!(factory.stripe_webhook_secret, "whsec_stripe");
        assert_eq!(factory.paypal_client_id, "client_id_paypal")
```
